text:
Historically, REIT index returns and global equity returns have had a relatively strong
correlation (on the order of 0.6) because business cycles affect REITs and global equities
similarly. The correlation between global bond returns and REIT returns has been
very low historically. In either case diversification benefits can result from including
real estate in an investor's portfolio. However, the methods of index construction
(e.g., appraisal or repeat sales indices) may be a factor in the low reported correlations,
in which case actual diversification benefits may be less than expected.
